âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Hybrid detection (Random Forest/XGBoost + rule-based checks) â€¢ Real-time predictions with confidence scores â€¢ Handles obfuscated/novel malware better than signature-based tools â€¢ Static feature extraction (entropy, imports, metadata)
ðŸ“– Summary: ExeRay is a tool for detecting malicious Windows executables using machine learning. It employs a hybrid detection approach combining Random Forest and XGBoost algorithms with rule-based checks. The tool extracts static features like entropy, imports, and metadata for real-time classification, offering an advantage over signature-based methods in handling obfuscated or novel malware.
